nodes.html: The unique entity identifier used in SAM.gov has changed.

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: On April 4, 2022, the unique entity identifier used across the federal government changed from the DUNS Number to the Unique Entity ID (generated by SAM.gov).

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: • The Unique Entity ID is a 12-character alphanumeric ID assigned to an entity by SAM.gov.

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: • As part of this transition, the DUNS Number has been removed from SAM.gov.

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: • Entity registration, searching, and data entry in SAM.gov now require use of the new Unique Entity ID.

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: • Existing registered entities can find their Unique Entity ID by following the steps here.

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: • New entities can get their Unique Entity ID at SAM.gov and, if required, complete an entity registration.
